work.title: 9th grade observation course
work.desc: 1-week observation internship in a research laboratory on materials, processes and surfaces.

work.title: Volunteering — Bakery workshop
work.desc: 4-day volunteering for the Festival des Mômes bakery workshop.

work.title: Summer job — Fast food employee
work.desc: I learned to work in a team, manage stress and be versatile.

work.title: Internship — Web Developer
work.desc: I worked on an introductory Symfony project, then on a client project selling products and accessories for utility vehicles.

work.title: Apprenticeship — Web Developer
work.desc: I worked on different projects, notably on an e-commerce site for a company that rents equipment for events and a showcase site for the promotion of a communication application.

education.diploma: General Baccalaureate — Mathematics and Engineering Sciences
education.name: Germaine Tillion high school
education.desc: General baccalaureate obtained with mention of Enough-good. Mathematics and Engineering Sciences, with Physics-Chemistry stopped at the end of 12th grade.

education.name: IUT Nord Franche-Comté
education.desc: University degree in computer technology. I learned the basics of programming, project management and communication.

education.name: IUT Nord Franche-Comté
education.desc:
University Bachelor of Technology in computer science (continuation of the DUT).
Declaring with a dual training at Web&Design to deepen my skills in Web development and project management.

miscellaneous.title: 1st year university projects
miscellaneous.name: IUT Nord Franche-Comté
miscellaneous.desc: List of the projects carried out in the 1st year of BUT Informatique. These projects are called “SAE” which means “Learning and Assessment Situation”, and were carried out in groups of 2 to 6 students depending on the complexity of the project.

miscellaneous.title: 2nd year university projects
miscellaneous.name: IUT Nord Franche-Comté
miscellaneous.desc: List of the projects carried out in the 2nd year of BUT Informatique.

miscellaneous.title: 3rd year university projects
miscellaneous.name: IUT Nord Franche-Comté
miscellaneous.desc: List of the projects carried out in the 3rd year of BUT Informatique. These are mainly projects carried out in alternance.

university.title: First year projects
university.desc: The first year of the Bachelor of Information Technology is dedicated to acquiring the foundational skills necessary for progressing in the field of computer science. Students become familiar with key programming concepts, learn to structure and manage a project from start to finish, and begin to develop communication skills essential for effective teamwork.

projects.title: Token game in Java
projects.descShort: A strategic board game developed in Java, incorporating a JavaFX interface and artificial intelligences to enrich the gameplay experience.
projects.descFull: The Token game in Java is a strategic board game where two players alternately place tokens of increasing value on a board of 21 squares. Each player must minimize the sum of the points around a remaining empty square to win. This project showcases my skills in Java, JavaFX for the user interface, and programming artificial intelligences to enhance the game. Completed as a pair, this project allowed me to deepen my application development skills, algorithm optimization, and teamwork.

content.title: Application development
content.desc: This project allowed me to strengthen my application development skills in Java. Using JavaFX to create an intuitive graphical interface was a significant part of the work.

competences.title: Develop simple computer applications
competences.desc: We created a game in Java with a polished graphical interface thanks to JavaFX. My goal was to ensure a smooth user experience.

content.title: Optimization of applications
content.desc: This project also gave me the opportunity to work on performance optimization and algorithm efficiency.

competences.title: Understanding and building algorithms
competences.desc: We created and implemented algorithms for game rules and artificial intelligences. This enhanced the complexity of the game and offered an interesting challenge for players.

projects.title: Computer systems administration
projects.descShort: Configure and administer workstations and network services to ensure an efficient IT infrastructure.
projects.descFull: This project involved installing and configuring workstations in a network environment to ensure connectivity and system security. We set up secure work environments, deployed network services, and solved connectivity issues. Working on this project with two other students allowed me to strengthen my system administration skills, particularly in workstation management and network configuration.

content.title: Workstation management
content.desc: We learned to install and configure workstations to create secure and efficient work environments. This was essential to ensure that each user had a workstation tailored to their needs.

competences.title: Install and configure workstations
competences.desc: We set up workstations with customized configurations to meet the specific needs of users. This included installing software, configuring devices, and optimizing performance.

content.title: Network configuration
content.desc: We participated in creating a robust network architecture to ensure connectivity and security of IT systems.

competences.title: Configure network services
competences.desc: We deployed and configured network services like DHCP, DNS, and firewalls. This ensured that all devices on the network could communicate effectively and securely.

projects.title: Carpooling website
projects.descShort: Carpooling site in Python with Flask, and MySQL for the database.
projects.descFull: The project involved creating a carpooling website in Python with Flask, and MySQL for the database. The site allowed users to offer rides with departure or arrival in Belfort and to search for carpoolers to share travel expenses. This project enabled us to practice our web development and database query skills. We worked in a group of 3 students.

content.title: Web development
content.desc: This project allowed us to create a complete website using Python with Flask. We worked on HTML templates for the user interface and on interactions with the MySQL database.

competences.title: Develop a website
competences.desc: We developed a carpooling site where users can search, register, and post rides. This feature allows drivers and passengers to connect and share their journeys.

content.title: Database queries
content.desc: We used MySQL to store and manage all the information about trips, users, and carpoolers.

competences.title: Interact with a database
competences.desc: We created SQL queries to insert, update, delete, and retrieve data from the database. This ensured that all site information was well-organized and easily accessible.

projects.title: Kamisado game in Java
projects.descShort: The Kamisado game in Java, a strategic board game where each player must move their piece to the opponent's line.
projects.descFull: Players move their piece based on the color of the square it stands on, trying to block the opponent. This project allowed us to practice our skills in Java, JavaFX for the graphic interface, algorithmic for the game logic, and the development of artificial intelligences. We developed two different AIs to offer a varied challenge to players. We worked in a group of 6 for the realization of this project.

content.title: Application development
content.desc: We created a board game in Java with a graphical interface in JavaFX to offer an optimal user experience.

competences.title: Develop applications in Java
competences.desc: We created a complete board game in Java with features for movement, blocking, and winning.

content.title: Algorithmic
content.desc: We set up the movement algorithm of the pieces according to the game rules to ensure a smooth and strategic gameplay experience.

competences.title: Build algorithms
competences.desc: We developed a movement algorithm for the pieces based on the game rules for a realistic gameplay experience.

content.title: Artificial Intelligences
content.desc: We developed two different artificial intelligences to offer a varied challenge to players. Each AI has unique behaviors to make the game more interesting.

competences.title: Develop artificial intelligences
competences.desc: We created two AIs with different levels of difficulty to enrich the gameplay experience.

content.title: Teamwork
content.desc: Collaborating with other students was essential for the realization of the project. We distributed tasks and ensured effective communication throughout the project.

competences.title: Work in a team
competences.desc: We divided the tasks among team members to efficiently carry out the project.

projects.title: E-commerce site in Python
projects.descShort: E-commerce site for ski sales in Python with Flask, and MySQL for the database.
projects.descFull: The project involved creating an e-commerce site for ski sales in Python with Flask, and MySQL for the database. The site allowed users to view products, add them to the cart, place orders, and manage their account. This project enabled us to practice our web development and database management skills. It also included project management and deployment of the site on Pythonanywhere. We worked in a group of 3 students.

content.title: Web development
content.desc: We created a complete e-commerce site using Python with Flask. We worked on HTML templates for the user interface and on interactions with the MySQL database.

competences.title: Develop an e-commerce site
competences.desc: We created an online sales site where users can view products, add them to the cart, place orders, and manage their accounts. This feature allows for a complete shopping experience for users.

content.title: Database management
content.desc: We used MySQL to store and manage all the information about products, users, and orders.

competences.title: Interact with a database
competences.desc: We created SQL queries to insert, update, delete, and retrieve data from the database. This ensured that all site information was well-organized and easily accessible.

content.title: Project management
content.desc: We planned tasks, distributed roles, and monitored the project to ensure efficient and timely completion.

competences.title: Manage an IT project
competences.desc: We organized and followed the different stages of the project, allowing us to meet deadlines and maintain good coordination among team members.

content.title: Site deployment
content.desc: We deployed the site on Pythonanywhere to make it accessible online.

competences.title: Deploy a web application
competences.desc: We configured and launched the site on Pythonanywhere, allowing users to access the site securely and reliably.

university.title: Second year projects
university.desc: The second year of the Bachelor of Information Technology allows students to consolidate and deepen the skills previously acquired. They focus more on web development, refine their project management approach, and continue to strengthen their communication skills. This year concludes with a three-month internship in a company, offering a first concrete immersion in the professional world.

projects.title: La Cour Médiévale de Monseigneur Ambert
projects.descShort: This site aims to manage the convention "La Cour Médiévale de Monseigneur Ambert", a medieval convention taking place at Montby Castle, in Doubs. This convention was entirely imagined and designed by the site's development team.
projects.descFull: This project was completed by a group of 5 students and allowed us to practice our web development, project management, and communication skills. The site manages participant registrations, proposed activities, stands, and entertainment, as well as practical information about the event. We used HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VueJS, and PostgreSQL to create this application, following the agile SCRUM methodology for project management.

content.title: Database
content.desc: For the database, we started by creating a MCD with another student to identify the different tables and associations needed. We used the Looping tool for the conceptual data modeling. We chose PostgreSQL for its ability to manage database tables efficiently. After debating which method to use for the queries, we opted for the ORM Sequelize to simplify interactions with the database and improve code readability. Then, we created the Sequelize models, detailing each table, its attributes, and its associations.

content.title: Backend
content.desc: For the backend, we developed a REST API using NodeJS, known for its flexibility and performance. This API allows communication with our database and performs CRUD operations. NodeJS also enabled us to manage requests asynchronously, thus optimizing performance and ensuring a reactive user experience.

content.title: Frontend
content.desc: We developed the frontend using VueJS, a modern JavaScript framework. VueJS allowed us to create interactive and dynamic pages, dividing the interface into reusable components. This approach facilitates maintenance and updates. We also used Vuex for state management and Vue Router for routing.

content.title: Skills developed
content.desc: In the realization of a site in NodeJS and VueJS, with a PostgreSQL database, several skills were developed:

competences.title: Realize application development
competences.desc: Master JavaScript programming and the fundamental principles of NodeJS to create the backend of the application. Use VueJS to develop the frontend and create interactive user interfaces. Set up an appropriate software architecture to ensure the modularity and maintainability of the application.

competences.title: Optimize computer applications
competences.desc: Understand performance and optimization principles to minimize response times and loading times of the application. Use caching techniques to improve performance, especially for frequent database queries.

competences.title: Administer complex communicating computer systems
competences.desc: Configure and manage NodeJS application servers to ensure the proper functioning of the application. Ensure communication between the different components of the system, such as communication between the VueJS frontend and the NodeJS backend.

competences.title: Manage information data
competences.desc: Design and model the PostgreSQL database by defining the tables, relationships, and constraints. Use SQL queries to interact with the database, retrieve, insert, update, or delete data.

competences.title: Conduct a project
competences.desc: Plan and organize the different stages of the development of the site, defining the objectives, necessary resources, and deadlines. Follow good project management practices, such as using version management tools (Git) and documenting the code.

competences.title: Work in an IT team
competences.desc: Collaborate with other developers for the simultaneous development of the frontend and backend. Use project management tools (such as Trello) to facilitate coordination and communication within the team.

projects.title: Data exploitation and visualization
projects.descShort: As part of a group project involving three people, we analyzed and visualized data from various sources to extract crucial insights, thereby strengthening decision-making.
projects.descFull: This project aimed to analyze data from different sources to extract meaningful insights intended to improve decision-making. To achieve this, we used techniques for data collection, cleaning, and transformation before proceeding with a statistical analysis. We then presented the results in the form of clear and informative visualizations. This project allowed us to deepen our skills in data analysis, data processing, and visualization of results.

content.title: Data collection and cleaning
content.desc: We collected raw data from various sources such as CSV files and APIs. The cleaning process included removing duplicates, correcting errors, and managing missing values. These steps were essential to ensure the quality of future analyses.

competences.title: Data preparation
competences.desc: We set up a data collection and cleaning strategy to ensure their quality and reliability before starting the analysis.

content.title: Statistical data analysis
content.desc: We conducted an in-depth statistical analysis to discover hidden trends and patterns. This analysis helped us validate hypotheses and extract valuable information for informed decision-making.

competences.title: Analyze data
competences.desc: Use statistical techniques to identify trends and validate hypotheses from collected data.

content.title: Data visualization
content.desc: Results were presented in the form of visualizations, using tools such as Matplotlib and Seaborn to create attractive and informative charts. These visualizations facilitated the communication of results and aided in data-based decision-making.

competences.title: Create data visualizations
competences.desc: Use libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn to transform analysis results into comprehensible charts.

content.title: Skills developed
content.desc: This project facilitated the development of the following skills:

competences.title: Optimize a database, interact with an application, and implement security
competences.desc: Use API queries to extract data and integrate it into a database. Optimize database performance to ensure rapid and efficient interaction with the application. Implement security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure the confidentiality of information.

competences.title: Apply a project monitoring approach according to the business needs of clients and users
competences.desc: Identify the business needs and objectives of users to guide data collection and analysis. Track key performance indicators to assess the effectiveness of analyses and visualizations. Adapt methods and tools based on user feedback.

competences.title: Collaborate within an IT team
competences.desc: Distribute tasks among team members to optimize efficiency and productivity. Regular and transparent communication to ensure effective coordination and a mutual understanding of objectives. Share knowledge and skills to strengthen team cohesion and promote mutual learning.

projects.title: Internship — Web Developer
projects.descShort: A 3-month internship in a company to practice my web development skills.
projects.descFull: I completed a 3-month internship in a company at Web&Design, a web development agency specializing in creating showcase sites and e-commerce sites. I worked on various projects, including a site for selling products and accessories for commercial vehicles. I was able to practice my skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Symfony, and MySQL to develop advanced features and optimize the site's performance. I also participated in project management using the SCRUM method to organize teamwork and track the progress of the project.

content.title: Backend development
content.desc: This internship allowed me to develop and perfect my backend development skills. I used Symfony and Doctrine to create advanced features and efficiently manage the site's data.

competences.title: Use Symfony and Doctrine
competences.desc: Creation of advanced features such as product management, orders, and user management. Use of Doctrine for database management and query optimization.

competences.title: Performance optimization
competences.desc: Improvement of site performance to ensure smooth and fast navigation. Implementation of caching techniques and optimization of SQL queries.

competences.title: Create an administrator space
competences.desc: Development of an administrator space to allow content and user management of the site. Use of Symfony to create user-friendly and secure user interfaces.

content.title: Agile project management
content.desc: As a member of the development team, I participated in project management using the agile SCRUM method. This experience allowed me to better understand the organization and coordination necessary to successfully carry out a project.

competences.title: Work organization in sprints
competences.desc: Use of the SCRUM method to organize work in sprints, define objectives, and track project progress. Participation in planning and retrospective meetings to evaluate progress and adjust priorities.

competences.title: Collaboration with the team
competences.desc: Close collaboration with other team members to define tasks, exchange ideas, and solve problems. Adaptation to client feedback to ensure customer satisfaction and quality of the final product.

university.title: Third year projects
university.desc: I completed my third year of the Bachelor of Information Technology as an apprentice, which offered me the opportunity to apply my web development and project management skills in a professional environment. During this year, I participated in several concrete projects, such as creating an e-commerce site for an event equipment rental company, developing a showcase site to promote a communication application, and other varied applications. This experience in a company allowed me to better understand the demands of the workplace while continuing my training.

projects.title: E-commerce site — Chips-Events
projects.descShort: Collaborative development of an e-commerce site dedicated to renting event equipment.
projects.descFull: Our team worked together to create an e-commerce platform for renting event equipment. This project involved modeling complex data and integrating secure payment systems.

content.title: Skills developed
content.desc: This project allowed me to strengthen my web development and data management skills. Here are some specific aspects I worked on:

competences.title: Complex data modeling
competences.desc: Using Symfony, we designed data models tailored to the specific needs of the client. Integration of MySQL databases enabled efficient management of product and order information, with complex relationships between different entities to ensure data consistency and integrity.

competences.title: External data integration
competences.desc: We connected the site to external data sources, including via APIs, to enrich the available information. The ERP Odoo was used to manage stocks and orders in real time, while PayPlug was integrated to ensure secure payments.

competences.title: Backend and Frontend development
competences.desc: On the backend, I contributed to the development of key features such as order management, cart management, and user management using Symfony and Doctrine. For the frontend, I worked on performance optimization and the creation of interactive components in JavaScript to enhance the user experience.

competences.title: Agile project management
competences.desc: Following the SCRUM method, our team organized work in sprints, allowing us to effectively track the progress of the project. We collaborated closely to define objectives, prioritize tasks, and adapt to client feedback, ensuring the quality of the final product.

projects.title: Showcase site — ComInTime
projects.descShort: Collaborative design of a showcase site to promote a communication application.
projects.descFull: We worked on the development of a showcase site aimed at promoting the ComInTime application. This project included managing the displayed content, a blog, contact features, a detailed presentation of the application, and a direct link to it.

content.title: Skills developed
content.desc: This project allowed me to deepen my web development and content management skills. Here are the aspects I particularly worked on:

competences.title: Creating showcase websites
competences.desc: We used Symfony to set up a complete showcase site, incorporating features such as content management, a blog, and contact forms. Integration of CMS facilitated the daily management of the site, and we also optimized the site for SEO to improve its visibility on search engines.

competences.title: Frontend and Backend development
competences.desc: I contributed to the creation of interactive frontend components in JavaScript, using Stimulus for a smooth user experience. On the backend, Symfony and Doctrine were used to manage site data, including for blog articles and various forms.

competences.title: Collaboration and communication
competences.desc: As a team, we defined together the objectives, tasks, and deadlines of the project. Regular communication was essential to track progress and solve problems. We also took into account feedback from the company's communication department to adjust the site according to their needs.

projects.title: Application — ComInTime
projects.descShort: Adding new features to an existing communication application.
projects.descFull: We worked on improving the ComInTime application by developing new features. These included an email notification system, a tool for importing previous social network posts, and a link preview in the content of posts.

content.title: Skills developed
content.desc: This project allowed me to deepen my skills in web application development and data management. Here are the aspects I particularly worked on:

competences.title: Development of new features
competences.desc: I used Symfony to add features to the existing application, including an email notification system to inform users about new posts. We also set up a system for importing previous social network posts to enrich the content available in the application.

competences.title: Performance optimization
competences.desc: I worked on improving the application's performance, optimizing queries and data processing. The use of advanced caching techniques helped reduce loading times, ensuring smoother navigation for users.

competences.title: Agile project management
competences.desc: Following the SCRUM method, our team organized work in sprints, allowing us to effectively track the progress of the project. Close collaboration with the team and regular feedback from the communication department were essential to adjust the product to actual needs.

competences.title: Integration of external services
competences.desc: We connected the application to LinkedIn and Meta APIs to import relevant data, enriching the content offered. The integration of email notification systems kept users informed about updates and new posts.

projects.title: Application — CNCE
projects.descShort: Enhancement of the CNCE site with technical updates and new administrative features.
projects.descFull: We worked on updating the CNCE application by moving from Symfony 4 to Symfony 6, while adding administrative features for managing public surveys. This included creating dynamic forms and setting up a secure API for data administration.

content.title: Migration to Symfony 6
content.desc: The transition of the CNCE application from Symfony 4 to Symfony 6 took advantage of the latest advancements in the framework, offering increased performance and enhanced security. This migration required a partial code overhaul to ensure that all existing features were compatible with the new version.

content.title: Development of administrative features
content.desc: We added new features to improve the management of public surveys. These improvements include dynamic forms that allow flexible and efficient data entry, and a secure REST API to facilitate administration and access to information.

competences.title: Creating dynamic forms
competences.desc: We developed dynamic forms to manage the entry and organization of public survey data, making the process more intuitive for administrators.

competences.title: Setting up a secure API
competences.desc: A secure REST API was implemented to allow centralized administration of data, ensuring the protection of sensitive information and facilitating integration with other services.

projects.title: Application — Preambules
projects.descShort: Update and extension of the Preambules site with new features and integrations.
projects.descFull: We worked on improving the Preambules site by adding new features, particularly in the member area for registered users, and integrating third-party services to enrich the site's content.

content.title: Update of the member area
content.desc: We improved the member area by fixing bugs, optimizing the user interface, and adding new features to offer a better experience for registered users.

content.title: Integration with third-party services
content.desc: Integration of the CNCE API was carried out via a command to enrich the site's data. This allowed us to add new features based on this data, making the site more interactive and informative.
